word:
Chapter Thirty-Seven - The Wealth of the Gentiles

     Not to Take Means From the Cause.--The tithe is set apart for a special use. It is not to be regarded as a poor fund. It is to be especially devoted to the support of those who are bearing God's message to the world, and it should not be diverted from this purpose.--Review and Herald, Supplement, Dec. 1, 1896.
